headline: Pressure Cooker Teriyaki Chicken
description: Chicken thighs, crushed pineapple, cider vinegar, soy sauce, and spices are cooked in the pressure cooker for delicious teriyaki chicken in less than an hour!
name: Pressure Cooker Teriyaki Chicken

recipeInstructions.text: Combine brown sugar, soy sauce, cider vinegar, ginger, garlic powder, pepper, crushed pineapple and juice, and chicken stock in a bowl and stir until the brown sugar is dissolved.

Place chicken thighs in the pressure cooker and pour in the sauce. Stir gently to coat. Bring the pressure cooker up to high pressure over high heat, then reduce the heat to low, maintaining high pressure. Cook for 20 minutes.
Stir cornstarch into cold water and set aside.

Reduce the pressure using the rapid-release method. Use a slotted spoon to transfer the chicken to a serving dish; cover with foil and set aside. Whisk the cornstarch mixture into the sauce, bring the mixture to a boil, and cook, stirring frequently, until the sauce has thickened, about 3 minutes. Serve the chicken topped with the teriyaki sauce.

review.reviewBody: I really liked this dish. It was more mild of a teriyaki flavor than I was expecting, but still good. I used a brown sugar substitute and low sodium tamari for the soy, other than that, added chopped carrot and bell to pot. I did cook a little less than specified time and the chicken was nice and tender. Hubs really enjoyed it over rice and topped with green onions, toasted sesame seeds and peanuts. (For me, I marinated a tilapia filet in the sauce while everything cooked, then sautéed it in EVOO , served over cauliflower rice with same toppings.) Will do again, worked quite well both ways!

This was excellent! I gave it 4 stars because I needed to make changes and did not follow the recipe exactly. I did not have the vinegar so I cut down to 1/2 cup soy sauce and added 1/2 cup teriyaki sauce & marinade. I did not have ground ginger so I used minced ginger from a jar. I poured the hot chicken/ sauce over cut up green pepper chunks and let it sit for a few minutes to pick up the pepper flavor. The whole family loved it!!

It was ok. Really lacking in texture. Needs something to add crunch...
One note flavor.
I won't make it again.
I love pineapple .. WOW I love this recipe and so easy
Excellent. It is in my favorites.
Mixed reviews in this picky family. One teenage son loved it, the other hated it. My husband and I thought it wasn’t terrible, but wouldn’t make it again.
Good but not great. Lacked the restaurant quality as the sauce missed that sticky, yummy gooey sauce. I followed the recipe exactly.

Excellent recipe with opportunity to tweak it to individual tastes. I added more garlic, left out the pineapple, and used far less white sugar. Served with frozen stir fry vegetables mixed in with the chicken, over rice. Great meal!
Absolutely excellent. Served with rice cooked in water & pineapple juice and asparagus with yum yum sauce. Very good.
Great dish but I think it would be better grilled..
SOOOO Good! My family loved it!
Easy peasy in my electric pressure cooker. The sauce was delicious and the chicken so tender. Just follow the directions and serve over rice (I prefer Basmati rice). My husband loved it.
Recipe was easy to follow and the end result was very good. I ate all of it.
Followed the recipe. Perfect. If you use the instant-pot you dont need to fire it back up once you pull the chicken out to mix in the starch. It will be plenty hot still
I used thawed thighs at 12 minutes +4 minutes NR, then QR. Fall apart tender!
Not bad, just not the flavor I was looking for
The ginger powder was a little to strong for my liking. The corn starch mixture did not change the consistency of the sauce. Overall wasn’t to bad, just need to adjust to my liking.

This was so good! I also used a package of boneless skinless thighs from Costco, for 20 minutes. Separately steamed some veggies and mixed everything together once the sauce was done. Served over white rice and the family loved it! Will definitely make again!
Made to recipe. Was short on ginger so only one tablespoon went in. It has a bit that wasn’t expected. Will definitely make again.

This was a hit with our company. I did decrease sugar to 1/2 cup after reading many reviews, and I cooked it in my InstantPot for 10 minutes, that was more than enough. To thicken the sauce, I simply put the instant pot with sauce (chicken removed with slotted spoon) on the stove and added the cornstarch

Halved the brown sugar. Used canned sliced pineapple but did not put it in to cook with the chicken. Used chicken broth instead of stock because that is what I had on hand. Set the Instant Pot for 12 minutes; chicken was done. Took the chicken out and tried to cook the rice in the Instant Pot. Messed up the proportions by using 1 cup of rice to about 2 cups of liquid. Did not finish cooking and had a lot of liquid left over, so drained the rice and put it on the stove with a little more liquid. Took the rest of the liquid and added corn starch to make the best sauce! The rice was very good once it finished on the stove and dinner was a success!
This was nasty.
Turned out really good! This is definitely a dish I’ll make again. I topped it with sesame seeds.
Seemed heavy on the soy sauce. Next time I’ll add more sweet, plus bell pepper and onion.

Tried it tonite, with 3 chicken breasts. Instead of garlic powder, added 1 tsp. fresh garlic and a bit of onion powder. I probably didn’t allow enough time to really thicken the sauce, bit this is definitely a dish that I will make again.

Yalllllll I thought I was doomed

Realized after starting that I was missing not only broth, but ginger AND soy sauce!! I was panicked 

Substituted the ginger and soy sauce with Dale's as it's primarily soy sauce with some ginger garlic onion etc
Substituted broth with some chicken knorr and water 

It came out so good still! And the chicken so tender
I'm sure the original recipe is even better
Amazing flavor! Absolutely loved this!!
This was very easy to make, chicken was moist and tender. I threw broccoli in with the chicken while I was waiting for the sauce to thicken. Very good indeed.
Tasty!!! Brown sugar & pineapple adds a nice sweet flavor.
Delicious!! Made it without any changes to recipe!!!
Moust & Delicious! On my insta pot there isn't a function to lower the temperature. Instead I lowered the pressure. I didn't put in the whole can of pineapple, just some juice and a few chuncks.
very good with brown rice

I followed the ingredients as listed on the recipe, but 2 TABLEspoons of ground ginger and garlic powder was too much. I will definitely just use 2 TEAspoons next time I make it. My pressure cooker instruction booklet said to cook boneless chicken thighs for 8 mins on high pressure and that time was plenty.
My husband absolutely LOVED it!! It was really easy, very quick and very tasty. I'll definitely make it again.

I made this dish and it was delicious! The entire family agreed it was full of flavor and very moist! The only change I made was that I used coconut aminos instead of the soy sauce. Will definitely be adding this recipe into the rotation.

This comes out so tasty and I love that it only took 20 minutes in my electric pressure cooker (I thawed my chicken thighs first). The only substitutions I made were worcestershire sauce instead of soy sauce and finely chopped mandarin oranges instead of crushed pineapples. I served it over rice and a side dish of mixed Asian vegetables. I ran out of time to do the cornstarch the thicken the sauce but it was delicious even without that step. I will definitely make this dish again,

The family LOVED it! I love that I had everything on hand and it was super easy to put together. I did take the advice of other reviewers (I always read the reviews!) and reduced the sugar by half and reduced the cooking time. My Cuisinart pressure cooker did the job in 8 minutes.

I saw the comments about being too sweet, so I cut the brown sugar to 1/2 cup. Also my daughter doesn’t like pineapple so I pureed that before adding it. And we like breasts, so I used frozen chicken tenderloins, cooked as suggested. Added broccoli and carrots on the side. My family loved it. This is definitely something I will make again.
worth making again. I would add bell pepper and onion next time. This recipe reminds me of a cross between Chicken teriyaki and sweet and sour.
I made this and my family loved it. Served it over rice with some steamed broccoli. Will definitely make again!
So easy and yummy!
My family loved it (and it's hard to get everyone to agree on one thing). I put mine over broccoli (for a healthier version), my husband and son put it over white rice.

It was amazing on top of chicken flavored rice and a bag of Asian medley
I also used boneless skinless chicken breast cut into half inch strips

Wow. Amazing. I followed the recipe, but I did read the reviews and decided to take all the advice. I used thin chicken breasts and cut them into bite sized chunks, and I only cooked for 14 minutes. One thing that made this easy is I made the sauce in a super tall cup with a hand blender. That made it easy and fast. Make sure to also use the juice from the pineapple can!
delicious and tasty. leftover became lunches.
Kida and husband loved it!

This turned out very well. Everyone agreed we would have it again. I used boneless skinless chicken breasts and shredded it once done. Chicken was moist, sauce thickened right up as promised with cornstarch. This was a great 20 minute dinner and would work well if you added broccoli to it. I added a bit more ginger than the recipe called for (because I spilled it) but it came out just fine. It had a bit of a kick to it, but we liked it. Very simple, very quick. Definitely going into our dinner rotation!
Turned out great. I used the Instapot and cooked for 10 minutes on Poultry.
Too sweet. Not terrible, but not the “teriyaki” flavor I was expecting or hoping for. I probably won’t make again.

I followed the recipe as written with the exception of mincing fresh ginger (I did not have ground ginger on hand), marinating the meat in the sauce for two hours, and using chicken breasts. That last change is the important one. If you are cooking chicken breasts the timing of the cooking is critical. I cooked a little over 3 lbs of boneless, skinless chicken breasts that were halved in 10 minutes and they were slightly overcooked. 

The timing on thickening the sauce is inaccurate. It took about twice as much time (6 minutes) with twice as much corn starch. That said, the rating is four stars because I liked this recipe a lot but my wife did not. Five stars should be for a recipe that will be a crowd pleaser but some might find it a bit too sweet.

When the recipe was posted the AllRecipes team changed a few things. It was supposed to be only for an electric pressure cooker (any brand including Instant Pot) not a stove top. 20 minute cook time is for thighs so they fall apart and leave the chicken in the pot to break it up. Quick release pressure. It takes at least 3 or 4 Tbls of cornstarch mixed with a little water to thicken using the brown/saute setting. If you use breasts reduce the cook time in half.

Followed the recipe and it just wasn't proper teriyaki. I made 2 small changes: I used gluten-free, reduced sodium, soy sauce. I reduced sugar as recommended by other reviewers. It was still too sweet. Also the chicken didn't soak in the flavor, either. 
My recommendations would be: Add fresh garlic and ginger (minced) instead of the grounded or powdered. Only use 1/3 of recommended sugar if using gluten-free soy sauce. Lastly, double the sauce (without cornstarch) and use half to marinate the chicken the night before. Add cornstarch to the non-marinade half of the batch, if you'd like.

Other than this being way to sweet, it was pretty good. I used both chicken breasts and thighs (hubby doesn't like dark meat). I'm waiting to see how it is as a leftover dish to see if the spices meld together better. I think grated fresh ginger and minced garlic would enhance the flavor. It's worth another try.
The flavor was too strong and bitter for me, could have been the ginger?
Did not like AT ALL, and I like teriyaki. Very disappointed with bland results, dried out chicken and the sauce lacked color and flavor. Threw it all out.
I used boneless, skinless chicken breasts. Chicken was moist with a flavorful sauce.

I used chicken breast instead (because it was a better price, weird huh.) I cut them into 2x2 inch pieces. I have an instant pot and just used the soup button with no adjusting, I used a quick release, then I used the Saute function to thicken the sauce. Turned out pretty good. I think it would be better with chicken thighs though.

I really REALLY liked the sauce's taste--but it does fall short of both the dark color and sharp bold taste of teriyaki sauce. I'm planning a next time, using frozen Asian stir-fry veggies and serving this recipe over LO-MEIN noodles; that should hit 5 stars. LOVE the convenient ease--and amazing speed--of pressure cooking!!
Decent. . . .
This was great! I used an electric pressure cooker on high for 30 minutes, and made exactly according to the recipe. It was delicious and perfect.
Easy and excellent, you won’t be let down on this great tasting recipe!

This was a really good recipe! A couple things I did that really worked well: first of all I trimmed a ton of excess fat off the meat before cooking. Don't worry about trying to get it all off, or you'll be there all day! ;) Doing this at the beginning will eliminate the need to skim the fat off the top at the end. Secondly, I added a tsp of red pepper flakes to the sauce mixture and that really added a bit of a kick to the dish! I have a Pressure Cooker XL and as far as I can tell, there is not way to lower the heat during the process of cooking (I'm totally new the the pressure cooker thing, so I could be wrong?!), so I cooked it for 18 minutes on the chicken setting and it was falling apart good! Definitely a keeper recipe!
This is OUT OF THIS WORLD! I cut back some of the sugar and added minced garlic. There are no words to describe my husband's reaction....leftovers are GONE!
I used frozen drumsticks. Worked great! I should of used all the sugar and I didn't have enough pineapple. It was very good. I will definitely make it again.

Oof, this was really good! The only change I made was in the cooking time. I cut it to 14 mins. The chicken was so done, it was falling off the bones. Next time, I'm going to reduce it to 12 mins. 

The pressure cooker really seals in the flavor like the chicken had been marinated overnight. I served it on top of jasmine rice (also cooked in the pressure cooker). 

The other thing I did was that instead of making the gravy in the pressure cooker, I took the juice and put it in a pot on the stove and thickened the gravy there. While I did that, the rice was cooking (1 min in the pressure cooker). Oh, I will say that the gravy didn't thicken hardly at all with what was in the recipe. I might add just a tad more. 

I loved it and will definitely make it again.
LOVE IT! I used the instant pot--- from
Would make it again, but cut back on the ginger - it was a little too spicy.

It was a good recipe although not necessarily a great recipe. It was easy to prepare and tasted fine. I did cook the chicken for only 10 minutes instead of the suggested 20 minutes and it turned out great. This is an easy dinner to whip together for the family although I didn't feel it was good enough to serve it to company. I cooked this one in my Instant Pot. And if you don't have an Instant Pot yet, I suggest you do a little research and see if it might be a useful tool in your kitchen, too.
We loved it.
I followed the recipe , I cooked it my instapot . It was so good !!!
This turned out great! Since we can't use soy sauce I substituted with 1/3 the amount and used Brags. I will definitely be using the teriyaki sauce on other dishes since it tasted so good!

This was AMAZING! I used FROZEN boneless, skinless chicken breasts, because that's what we had. I added a bit more brown sugar to the sauce (AFTER cooking) because my super picky 6 year old prefers sweet to savory. He LOVED this, and so did we! We ate it for almost a whole week (changed sides & veggies) and NO ONE got bored! Much more than "just" a keeper; this will be my new go to meal if I forget to defrost something. I can't WAIT to try it with pork! I had all the ingredients in the pantry. Super easy, fast and delicious!!!

I used boneless skinless breaths and it was absolutely delicious
We had leftover sauce so saves it to use for leftovers !

I made no changes and it was fantastic!
This was my maiden voyage with my electric pressure cooker. This was a winner!
Plenty of leftovers too :D
We both thought this was great! It was fast, easy and delicious. It's a keeper

I halved the amount of ginger because I'm not a huge fan of the flavor. This recipe was DELICIOUS and tender. I ended up using a second pan to boil the teriyaki sauce and corn startch mixture. My kids loved it.

Made this yesterday, so good. I did cut the sugar and pepper in half. Used five pounds skinless thighs and pulled the bones while shredding.. There was still plenty of sauce. Not dry at all. People using chicken breasts will have dry meat because they cook much faster. No reason to rate the recipe down when it was your change that caused it.

This was super easy, and tasted great! The only difference was I used Braggs aminos, as I was out of soy sauce. I had fresh ginger, so used half fresh ginger and half spice ginger. I served over rice with steamed broccoli...omg, simply awesome!

Simple and Fast. I served it over rice and the whole family enjoyed it! 
It was a little watery, so I'll have to play withit the next time I make it.

Made it exactly as the recipe says, except I had to add a bit more cornstarch for the sauce to thicken properly - al least for my taste. It was very, very good. Tender and moist and put over rice. Yum. It's a keeper!

It was my first time using the pressure cooker so I was really nervous and exhausted. The recipe over all was really simple to make. Next time, I would use boneless chicken breast or just cook it a little longer. My husband is picky about undercooked chicken. Need to get use to the pressure cooker.
Delicious!
This is the first recipe I ever made with my pressure cooker. Wow this was amazing. Only advice is add more then 3 pieces of chicken. We were fighting over the last piece

Only change I made was to add a whole can of chicken broth (low sodium), some dehydrated garlic & onion.Sauce was great. Chicken was tender. Used boneless, skinless chicken breasts because that is what I had. Will make again.
This was my first pressure cooker recipe ( I just purchased an electric pressure cooker ) and it was delicious. The chicken was extremely moist and very flavorful. I will definitely make this again

Great for a first time recipe in the Instant Pot. I only made two changes. I had a 2lb bag of frozen chicken tenders, so I added in raw broccoli and carrots, and I reduced the cooking time to 15 minutes. The chicken came out tender and tasty, and, even though the sauce is strong, I think it is perfect for pairing with a bland medium like white rice, brown rice, etc.

This was so easy to make and turned out perfect. For my family of 4, it was a crowd pleaser! I did not change the settings though. I cooked the chicken on high pressure for 20 minutes and it was perfect!
Would make again, added chopped garlic from jar and really thin slices of ginger. Sauce was really good. Ended up freezing leftover sauce in baggies for a quick sauce with white rice.

I was a little worried about the can of pineapple, but after reading a bunch of comments that was never a complaint from anybody. I did add a chopped onion and some frozen broccoli. The rest of the ingredients, I did exactly as the recipe called for except I used fresh ginger and lots of sirarcha and boneless skinless chicken thighs. I set my pressure cooker on stews/soup which cooks for 8 minutes. It turned out perfectly. So delicious. I will definitely be making this on a regular basis.
The recipe is great doesn't look like a tasty meal but the flavor it's what is counting

So I started making this and realized it said PRESURE cooker and not SLOW cooker. So I put all the ingredients in and put my slow cooker on high for about 6 hours. This was amazing!!! Will make again.
This is essentially a sweet & sour chicken recipe, not teriyaki. The sauce was okay, but too sweet for my taste and lacked the depth of flavor of true teriyaki.
Real nice recipe. No need to change a thing. I didn't have any garlic powder handy so I used fresh garlic instead.
Followed recipe to a "T" and my family of 5 gave it 5 stars. My daughter threw in some peanuts and I thought that was a nice addition, but this recipe doesn't need additions to be great.

I've made this a few times now. I add whole baby carrots to cook with the chicken. It's an awesome addition! I also add the cooked rice to the sauce in the cooker with the chicken so it's all mixed together and the rice soaks up some of the sauce. Mmmm Mmmm, good!

We really liked this recipe however the Soy Sauce is very over powering. I will be trying this again with less Soy Sauce. I used an electric Pressure Cooker. After I cooked the 2.35 lbs. of chicken tenders (15 mins), I removed the chicken from pot and added 2 cups of rice instead of cornstarch. After the rice was done I threw the chicken back in while the pot was on the warm cycle. The chicken was not dry at all! I will be making this dish again and adding veggie too.

The only thing I did was added 1/2 cup of soy sauce instead of 3/4. I probably could have used even less. Otherwise I did exactly as it said and it was awesome! Next time I make it I am going to add some crunchy veggies and maybe cashews or something just for some extra health!

This was a huge crowd pleaser. My wife and kids all enjoyed this. I decreased the ginger a little but added about 1.5 teaspoons of siracha to give it a little heat. This meal has officially been added to my family's dinner menu.

I only changed it slightly instead of chicken broth I added a cup of water and tossed in two bouillon cubes. I also added an onion chopped into bite size pieces. This was my very first electric pressure cooker recipe and I loved it. I used my 10 qt elite and the chicken was perfect not too dry either. Great recipe will make this again for sure.
